website_summaries.verdict: A basic police scanner that is the perfect choice for users who want a reliable analog model that is simple to use.
pros: A traditional analog model at an affordable price
Skywarn feature provides reliable storm warnings
Features 200 channels and the ability to be PC-programmed to back up data
cons: Tech enthusiasts and users in areas w/digital codes might not find this analog scanner to be useful

customer_reviews.title: Trash
customer_reviews.text: The weather alert channel requires you to actively engage the audio report upon hearing the alert tone . The unit continues to broadcast requiring one to turn the alert off when the report been heard. Programming is abominable - entering a specific frequency is impossible if the unit refuses to recognize the frequency entered and will instead round the number to what it considers a valid frequency. Total waste of money. Shame I didn't listen to the critical reviews. Don't waste your money on this unit. Amazon has better scanners I would commend to you.
customer_reviews.author: Newt

customer_reviews.title: EASY to use scanner that also has an am/fm radio
customer_reviews.text: My husband picked it out for my Dad and he LOVES it!!! My Dad is in his early 70's and doesn't have great eyesight but he can read the buttons on this one and the scanner itself is easy to use!!!! It sits on the table in his tv room and is on from the time he gets up till he goes to bed. He LOVES it!!! If you just want a simple scanner that is EASY to use this one is for you.
customer_reviews.author: Edge Obsessed

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT pick up car to car transmissions
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to program. Has little to no signal receiving power, can get some transmissions from Police/Fire base stations, but either VERY scratchy, or none from the mobile units responding. Frustrating because the mobile units are the ones giving the Lat/Longs of the fires. I'd hoped the handhelds had improved over the past 20 years, they have not. My Dad had a handheld years ago, it wasn't the greatest either, maybe good for in the city, but out in the country where the police/fire are transmitting from, miles away, this is pretty useless.
customer_reviews.author: EveryDayShopper

customer_reviews.title: lots of static
customer_reviews.text: Item works but there is a lot of static...called company and could not resolve the issue. Amazon sending another unit, hopefully this is one that actually works..have a radioshack desktop scanner on same channel, clear as a bell...ergo it is the whistler. 2nd unit has the same issue...these at amazon sold and fulfilled are bad units... Whistler no help!
customer_reviews.author: techie girl

customer_reviews.title: Great Desktop Scanner....But Be Wary of Potential Electrical Shock Risk
customer_reviews.text: We are a GA airport and need to monitor ATCT ground and tower transmission. The look, reception and value of this scanner is great. The reason I only give this one star is the 9v adapter does not sit flush with the plug-in. The Operations agent who installed this device received an electrical shock because the plug doesn't sit flush with the scanner. See photos. The plug is pushed in as far as it will go in the photo. I don't see anyway to contact the seller, and would hate to return it just because the adapter plug is too long.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa A. Noble

customer_reviews.title: Great Scanner to buy and enjoy
customer_reviews.text: The scanner is great snd you could pick various stations like weather, Police, emergency and some public stations and notice that if you live next to a Burger King in a station you could hear what people order to eat, and if you live next to an airport you could hear everything, so i highly recommend to but this scanner.
customer_reviews.author: perucho99

customer_reviews.title: Great scanner!
customer_reviews.text: Works great and have not had any problems with it at all. I hate reading instructions so i just put model number in youtube and boom i watched a video how to program and was so easy!
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t reach very far
customer_reviews.text: Had to return we just love to far out for this to work (we actually don’t live in what would be considered far away) This probably would work fine if you love in the city not for out in the country
customer_reviews.author: E. Curtiss

customer_reviews.title: A Scanner to be recommended!
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this scanner. It covers the range of frequencies as indicated but does perform better with the use of an outside antenna rather than the rubber ducky. The included package of accessories is quite impressive! Audio is very good & programming is made easy by reading the Guide carefully. Overall a very worthwhile purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Keneke

customer_reviews.title: Nice Scanner
customer_reviews.text: So far the scanner is doing great; I just wished there was a way to turn the backlight off; it stays on all the time. It was easy to program for the channels I need. Blocking a channel is easy as well.
customer_reviews.author: branchc

customer_reviews.title: Not totally satisfied with the unit so far
customer_reviews.text: After buying Bearcat Uniden and Radio Shack scanners for years and never had any issues with them. I thought I would switch to and try the Whistler. Not totally satisfied with the unit so far. The squelch just doesn't want to adjust right. Constantly having to adjust it which is not the way it should operate. Sometimes it also locks itself onto one frequency without continuing to scan. Will monitor it for a while longer then may return it and go back to Bearcat or Radio Shack.....sorry !!!
customer_reviews.author: Maureen Sylvester

customer_reviews.title: Works as it states easy to program works very well I love it and ...

customer_reviews.title: Good scanner for what it is intended to do'
customer_reviews.text: Good analog scanner up to 512MHz. If you want digital trunking in 800Mhz this radio will not do it. It is good for local police/fire/ems air/marine 2meter ham weather and FM commercial. Also has some good features such as key in frequencies manual channel entry etc. Good radio for someone just starting the hobby.

customer_reviews.title: Not exactly as described
customer_reviews.text: Not a true narrow band scanner. The scanner does automatically round the narrow band frequency up or down to the nearest wide band frequency. It does work and receives the frequency. YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR!

product_meta.title: Whistler WS1025 Analog Desktop Scanner (Black)
product_meta.description: Style:WS1025 Desktop Analog Scanner| Pattern Name:ScannerThe new scanner line opens with the WS1025. This 200 channel scanner features Data Cloning, PC updatable database capabilities, and dedicated Skywarn Storm Spotter Functionality - provides instant access to frequencies used by storm spotter networks. Monitor storm conditions as they occur, and become aware of dangerous conditions before the media or emergency management officials are able to announce them to the general public
feature_bullets: Lock-out Function - skip over specified channels or frequencies when scanning or searching
Tune - find new and unlisted frequencies starting from a specified frequency
Priority Channel - set the scanner to check one channel every two seconds while scanning
Scan Delay - delays scanning for two seconds before moving to another channel in order to hear replies
PC programmable - allows users to backup data, update database and program scanner directly from a PC

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars846 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
